p: Fennel originated by Umbelliferae contains anethole, fenchone, and limonene, which act as dopamine-like agents. 21 Anethole blocks dopamine receptors and inhibits endometrial contractions caused mainly by prostaglandins. 3 Thus, fennel supplements decrease pain perception in these patients. Along with the analgesic properties of this plant, mainly used as a herb in Chinese culture, the lack of side-effects during its use make it ideal therapy in cases of PD, where long-term treatment is required. Foeniculum vulgar Mill, publicly known as fennel, lowers pain scores in patients with PD and improves overall QoL. 12, 22
